description: Manage frontend IP addresses of a cross-region load balancer.

commands.name: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip create
commands.syntax:
az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip create --lb-name
                                              --name
                                              --resource-group
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--public-ip-address]
                                              [--public-ip-prefix]
                                              [--zone]
examples: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip create -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb -n MyFrontendIp --public-ip-address MyFrontendIp

commands.name: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip delete
commands.syntax:
az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip delete --lb-name
                                              --name
                                              --resource-group
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip delete -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb -n MyFrontendIp

commands.name: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip list
examples: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip list -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb

commands.name: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip show
commands.summary: Get the details of a frontend IP address.
examples: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip show -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb -n MyFrontendIp

commands.name: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip update
commands.syntax:
az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip update --lb-name
                                              --name
                                              --resource-group
                                              [--add]
                                              [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--public-ip-address]
                                              [--public-ip-prefix]
                                              [--remove]
                                              [--set]
                                              [--zone]
examples: az network cross-region-lb frontend-ip update -g MyResourceGroup --lb-name MyLb -n MyFrontendIp --public-ip-address MyFrontendIp
